mod_ssl.c:237: syntax error before `{'
mod_ssl.c:307: syntax error before `SSLConnRec'
mod_ssl.c:309: syntax error before `modssl_ctx_t'
*** Error code 1

Stop in /usr/ports/www/apache2/work/httpd-2.0.45/modules/ssl.

Which FreeBSD version?  Which gcc version?

If you replace the line

SSL_CMD_SRV(Mutex, TAKE1, ssl_valid_ssl_mutex_string)

with

SSL_CMD_SRV(Mutex, TAKE1, "some silly string")

does it then compile?

Thanks!
creator: trawick@apache.org
info@orangexl.com
text:
FreeBSD 4.7-stable, GCC 2.95.4.

I changed the line (@111) in mod_ssl.c, but make exited with the same errors :-(

I was able to build httpd-2.0.45 with mod_ssl just now on FreeBSD 4.7 with both
the OpenSSL 0.9.6g and OpenSSL 0.9.7a.  This is the original FreeBSD 4.7-RELEASE.

wget /url/to/httpd-2.0.45.tar.gz
tar -xzf httpd-2.0.45.tar.gz
cd httpd-2.0.45
./configure --enable-ssl --prefix=/somewhere \
--with-ssl=/usr/local/openssl-0.9.7a
make

What are the configure options used for your build?  What environment variables
(e.g., CFLAGS, CPPFLAGS, etc.) might affect the build?

It looks to me that you're using the FreeBSD port.  I would suggest trying pure
Apache 2.0.45, like I did.  If that works, then report the problem to the port
maintainer.
creator: trawick@apache.org
info@orangexl.com
text: Sorry, I indeed installed it from the ports-collection.
